strHandlingFlags.name: Grip Min-To-Max
strHandlingFlags.description: Lowers the traction in normal scenarios (increases lap time), but it will also let the tires have much more grip when they need it, up to max grip. This means the car will strongly resist sliding, and the traction will stay at max even beyond the peak slip angle (the car keeps gripping even at extreme angles of slide).

strHandlingFlags.name: TYRES_CAN_CLIP
strHandlingFlags.description: Lets the tires clip into the ground up to the height of the sidewall, making them absorb bumps better. If (1<<26) is set in strAdvancedFlags, the effect of this flag is tied to the sidewall of the stock tires, disregarding the actual sidewall of the current tires.

strHandlingFlags.name: OFFROAD_ABILITY
strHandlingFlags.description: A cut-down version of (1<<21). Doesn't include bush immunity, the power increase is less, and the gravity increase is only 10%. It moderately increases car performance in general.

strHandlingFlags.name: OFFROAD_ABILITY2
strHandlingFlags.description: Includes (1) bush immunity, (2) increased power, (3) increased gravity by 20% (results in faster falling and more traction). It strongly increases car performance in general.

strHandlingFlags.name: TYRES_RAISE_SIDE_IMPACT_THRESHOLD
strHandlingFlags.description: Causes the wheels to be included in the collision boundaries, such as with monster trucks.

strHandlingFlags.name: Offroad ability 3
strHandlingFlags.description: Formally "Rally car" or "Increased gravity" before that. We are yet to find a difference between this and (1<<21), so refer to that one for now.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Can be stanced
strAdvancedFlags.description: When used together with (1<<26), it enables the "Vehicle Stance" option in the interaction menu (such as with cars from the Tuners DLC).

strAdvancedFlags.name: Hard rev limit
strAdvancedFlags.description: For most vehicles the flag causes earlier upshifts and applies a speed limit to each gear (preventing mid-drive speed boosts using the handbrake). For Tuners it does not affect upshifts, but does apply a speed limit to the last two gears.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Over Revving
strAdvancedFlags.description: Causes the car to shift later than normal, making the engine bounce off the rev limiter before changing gear. When combined with (1<<16) the two cause the engine to rev in weird ways over bumps.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Bouncy Suspension
strAdvancedFlags.description: Causes the suspension to become a lot springier, especially at higher speed.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Longer gears
strAdvancedFlags.description: Makes all the gear ratios longer except for last gear and reverse which are always fixed at 0.90 and -3.333 respectively.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Stock rim radius
strAdvancedFlags.description: Limits the effect of the TYRES_CAN_CLIP (1<<17) handling flag, to where tire clipping is bound by the sidewall of the stock tires, regardless of how much sidewall the current tires have. This makes offroad wheels irrelevant.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Open wheel behavior
strAdvancedFlags.description: Includes (1) switching the downforce behavior to the open wheel style, (2) preventing speed gain from mechanics such as curb boosting or brake boosting, (3) counteracting the effect of downforce lowering the vehicle at high speed (or even flipping the effect if the downforce is low enough, making the vehicle raise at high speed).

strAdvancedFlags.name: Suspension affects roll
strAdvancedFlags.description: Makes suspension upgrades noticeably affect the body roll of the car, which can also cause the car's grip to change.

strAdvancedFlags.name: Special performance mods
strAdvancedFlags.description: Lets the vehicle have HSW performance mods. Can't be fully tested on PC yet.
